qas.question: Some scholars contest that there was only one what?
Who do some scholars think the Sumerian language originally belonged to?
Where did the original Sumerians live?
What culture did the peoples who would be called Sumerian have a part in?
When were the earliest historical records of Sumer?
What language is believed to have started among nomadic people?
What people lived in river region of Arabia?
Who was king in the 2600's BC?
Who believes the Sumerians lived in the area of modern Persia?

context: However, some scholars contest the idea of a Proto-Euphratean language or one <a0_0>substrate language<a0_0/>. It has been suggested by them and others, that the <b5_0><b6_0>Sumerian<b6_0/><b5_0/> language was originally that of the <a1_0>hunter and fisher peoples<a1_0/>, who lived in the <a2_0>marshland<a2_0/> and the Eastern Arabia littoral region, and were part of the <a3_0>Arabian bifacial<a3_0/> culture. Reliable historical records begin much later; there are none in Sumer of any kind that have been dated before <b7_0>Enmebaragesi<b7_0/> (c. <a4_0>26th century BC<a4_0/>). <b8_0>Professor Juris Zarins<b8_0/> believes the Sumerians were settled along the coast of Eastern Arabia, today's Persian Gulf region, before it flooded at the end of the Ice Age.
